intro: Doselia lopezii, commonly known as the Lopez's doselia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of white and yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Doselia lopezii is considered a species of conservation concern.
